TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LogRecord extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an unstructured log record delivered as a COM+ structure. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unstructured log records are delivered as a COM+ `CrmLogRecordRead` structure. In addition to the user data (a single BLOB), this contains additional fields that are useful for debugging or fault finding. The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.CompensatingResourceManager.LogRecord.Flags%2A> field is a bit field that provides further information about whether this record was forgotten at some point, and when it was written. The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.CompensatingResourceManager.LogRecord.Sequence%2A> field provides the sequence number of the log record. In most cases, sequence numbers are sequential but are not necessarily contiguous due to internal log records that are not delivered to the Compensating Resource Manager (CRM) Compensator.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this class.
[!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_27_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_27_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_27_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates when the log record was written.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values which provides information about when this record was written.

Docs.summary: Gets the log record user data.
Docs.value: A single BLOB that contains the user data.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this property.
[!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Crm#28](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: The sequence number of the log record.
Docs.value: An integer value that specifies the sequence number of the log record.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Sequence numbers are not necessarily contiguous due to internal log records or forgotten log records which are not delivered to the Compensating Resource Manager (CRM) Compensator.
